edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline

Class StanfordCoreNLPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.AnnotationPipeline
      • edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.StanfordCoreNLPClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Annotator

    public class StanfordCoreNLPClient
extends AnnotationPipeline
    An annotation pipeline in spirit identical to StanfordCoreNLP, but with the backend supported by a web server.
    Author:
    Gabor Angeli

    • Constructor Detail

      • StanfordCoreNLPClient

        public StanfordCoreNLPClient(Properties properties)
                      throws IllegalStateException
        Run the client, pulling credentials from the environment. Throws an IllegalStateException if the required environment variables aren't set. These are:
        • CORENLP_HOST
        • CORENLP_KEY
        • CORENLP_SECRET
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if we could not read the required environment variables.

      • StanfordCoreNLPClient

    • Method Detail

      • annotate

        public void annotate(Annotation annotation)
        Run the pipeline on an input annotation. The annotation is modified in place. This method creates an async call to the server, and blocks until the server has finished annotating the object.
        Specified by:
        annotate in interface Annotator
        Overrides:
        annotate in class AnnotationPipeline
        Parameters:
        annotation - The input annotation, usually a raw document

      • annotate

        public void annotate(Iterable<Annotation> annotations,
                     int numThreads,
                     java.util.function.Consumer<Annotation> callback)
        This method fires off a request to the server. Upon returning, it calls the provided callback method.
        Overrides:
        annotate in class AnnotationPipeline
        Parameters:
        annotations - The input annotations to process
        numThreads - The number of threads to run on. IGNORED in this class.
        callback - A function to be called when an annotation finishes.

      • annotate

        public void annotate(Annotation annotation,
                     java.util.function.Consumer<Annotation> callback)
        The canonical entry point of the client annotator. Create an HTTP request, send this annotation to the server, and await a response.
        Parameters:
        annotation - The annotation to annotate.
        callback - Called when the server has returned an annotated document. The input to this callback is the same as the passed Annotation object.

      • process

        public Annotation process(String text)
        Runs the entire pipeline on the content of the given text passed in.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to process
        Returns:
        An Annotation object containing the output of all annotators

      • run

        public void run()
         throws IOException
        The implementation of what to run on a command-line call of CoreNLPWebClient
        Throws:
        IOException - If any IO problem

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws InterruptedException

        Good practice to call after you are done with this object. Shuts down the queue of annotations to run and the associated threads.

        If this is not called, any job which has been scheduled but not run will be cancelled.

        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
        This can be used just for testing or for command-line text processing. This runs the pipeline you specify on the text in the file that you specify and sends some results to stdout. The current code in this main method assumes that each line of the file is to be processed separately as a single sentence.

        Example usage:
        java -mx6g edu.stanford.nlp.pipeline.StanfordCoreNLP -props properties -backends site1:port1,site2,port2
        or just -host name -port number

        Parameters:
        args - List of required properties
        Throws:
        IOException - If IO problem
        ClassNotFoundException - If class loading problem
